00031 // Nombre maximal de dimensions d'un tableau.
00032 // Meme macro dans IntTab et DoubleTab, test si c'est deja defini
00033 #ifndef MAXDIM_TAB
00034 #define MAXDIM_TAB 4

00047 //! Tableau a n entrees pour n<= 4<br>Repose sur un DoubleVect avec calculs de l'indice corespondant<br>Voir les commentaires de DoubleVect
00048 //

00122 private:
00123 // Nombre de dimensions du tableau (nb_dim_>=1)
00124   int nb_dim_;
00125 // Dimensions "reelles" (dimensions_[0] * line_size() = size_reelle())
00126 // line_size() est egal au produit des dimensions_[i] pour 1 <= i < nb_dim_
00127   int dimensions_[MAXDIM_TAB];
00128 // Dimension totale (nombre de lignes du tableau)
00129 // = nb lignes reeles + nb lignes virtuelles
00130 // Les dimensions dimension_tot(i>=1) sont implicitement
00131 // egales a dimension(i)
00132   int dimension_tot_0_;
00133 };

00155 inline double& DoubleTab::operator[](int i)
00156 {
00157   assert(nb_dim_ == 1 || (nb_dim_ == 2 && dimensions_[1] == 1));
00158   assert(i >= 0 && i < dimension_tot_0_);
00159   return DoubleVect::operator[](i);
00160 }
00161 
00162 inline const double& DoubleTab::operator[](int i) const
00163 {
00164   assert(nb_dim_ == 1 || (nb_dim_ == 2 && dimensions_[1] == 1));
00165   assert(i >= 0 && i < dimension_tot_0_);
00166   return DoubleVect::operator[](i);
00167 }

00169 inline double& DoubleTab::operator()(int i)
00170 {
00171   assert(nb_dim_ == 1 || (nb_dim_ == 2 && dimensions_[1] == 1));
00172   assert(i >= 0 && i < dimension_tot_0_);
00173   return DoubleVect::operator[](i);
00174 }
00175 
00176 inline const double& DoubleTab::operator()(int i) const
00177 {
00178   assert(nb_dim_ == 1 || (nb_dim_ == 2 && dimensions_[1] == 1));
00179   assert(i >= 0 && i < dimension_tot_0_);
00180   return DoubleVect::operator[](i);
00181 }
00182 
00183 inline double& DoubleTab::operator()(int i1, int i2)
00184 {
00185   assert(nb_dim_ == 2);
00186   assert(i1 >= 0 && i1 < dimension_tot_0_);
00187   assert(i2 >= 0 && i2 < dimensions_[1]);
00188   return DoubleVect::operator[](i1*dimensions_[1]+i2);
00189 }
00190 
00191 inline const double& DoubleTab::operator()(int i1, int i2) const
00192 {
00193   assert(nb_dim_ == 2);
00194   assert(i1 >= 0 && i1 < dimension_tot_0_);
00195   assert(i2 >= 0 && i2 < dimensions_[1]);
00196   return DoubleVect::operator[](i1*dimensions_[1]+i2);
00197 }
00198 
00199 inline double& DoubleTab::operator()(int i1, int i2, int i3)
00200 {
00201   assert(nb_dim_ == 3);
00202   assert(i1 >= 0 && i1 < dimension_tot_0_);
00203   assert(i2 >= 0 && i2 < dimensions_[1]);
00204   assert(i3 >= 0 && i3 < dimensions_[2]);
00205   return DoubleVect::operator[]((i1*dimensions_[1]+i2)*dimensions_[2]+i3);
00206 }
00207 
00208 inline const double& DoubleTab::operator()(int i1, int i2, int i3) const
00209 {
00210   assert(nb_dim_ == 3);
00211   assert(i1 >= 0 && i1 < dimension_tot_0_);
00212   assert(i2 >= 0 && i2 < dimensions_[1]);
00213   assert(i3 >= 0 && i3 < dimensions_[2]);
00214   return DoubleVect::operator[]((i1*dimensions_[1]+i2)*dimensions_[2]+i3);
00215 }
00216 
00217 inline double& DoubleTab::operator()(int i1, int i2, int i3, int i4)
00218 {
00219   assert(nb_dim_ == 4);
00220   assert(i1 >= 0 && i1 < dimension_tot_0_);
00221   assert(i2 >= 0 && i2 < dimensions_[1]);
00222   assert(i3 >= 0 && i3 < dimensions_[2]);
00223   assert(i4 >= 0 && i4 < dimensions_[3]);
00224   return DoubleVect::operator[](((i1*dimensions_[1]+i2)*dimensions_[2]+i3)*dimensions_[3]+i4);
00225 }
00226 inline const double& DoubleTab::operator()(int i1, int i2, int i3, int i4) const
00227 {
00228   assert(nb_dim_ == 4);
00229   assert(i1 >= 0 && i1 < dimension_tot_0_);
00230   assert(i2 >= 0 && i2 < dimensions_[1]);
00231   assert(i3 >= 0 && i3 < dimensions_[2]);
00232   assert(i4 >= 0 && i4 < dimensions_[3]);
00233   return DoubleVect::operator[](((i1*dimensions_[1]+i2)*dimensions_[2]+i3)*dimensions_[3]+i4);
00234 }
00235 
00236 //
00237 //
00238 //
00239 //
00240 //
00241 //
00242 //! Returns one of the "real" dimensions of the multi-dimensionnal array,<br>as defined by:<br>dimension(0) = size_reelle() / line_size(), or 0 if line_size()==0<br>and, for i >= 1:<br>dimension(i) is equal to dimension_tot(i)<br>If size_reelle_ok() returns 0, it is invalid to ask for dimension(0). You can only ask for<br>dimension_tot(0) (see DoubleVect::size_reelle_ok())
00243 inline int DoubleTab::dimension(int i) const
00244 {
00245   assert(i >= 0 && i < nb_dim_);
00246 // Si dimension_[0] == -1, c'est que c'est un vecteur distribue et que l'attribut size() est invalide.
00247 // Il faut alors utiliser dimension_tot pour ce tableau.
00248   assert(dimensions_[i] >= 0);
00249   return dimensions_[i];
00250 }
00251 
00252 //
00253 //! Returns the total dimensions of the multi-dimensionnal array, including<br>virtual items (used in parallel distributed arrays)
00254 inline int DoubleTab::dimension_tot(int i) const
00255 {
00256   assert(i >= 0 && i < nb_dim_);
00257   if (i == 0)
00258     return dimension_tot_0_;
00259   else
00260     return dimensions_[i];
00261 }
00262 
00263 //! Returns the number of dimensions of the array (>= 1)
00264 inline int DoubleTab::nb_dim() const
00265 {
00266   return nb_dim_;
00267 }
00268 
00269 // Precondition: line_size() must be equal to 1 and the array must be resizable.
00270 //! Adds 1 to dimension_tot(0) and puts a in the added line.
00271 inline void DoubleTab::append_line(double a)
00272 {
00273   assert(line_size() == 1);
00274   assert(dimension_tot_0_ * line_size() == size_array());
00275   const int n = dimension_tot_0_;
00276   dimensions_[0] = ++dimension_tot_0_;
00277   DoubleVect::resize_vect_(n+1, COPY_NOINIT);
00278   double * ptr = addr() + n;
00279   ptr[0] = a;
00280 }
00281 
00282 // Precondition: line_size() must be equal to 2 and the array must be resizable.
00283 //! Adds 1 to dimension_tot(0) and puts a and b in the added line.
00284 inline void DoubleTab::append_line(double a, double b)
00285 {
00286   assert(line_size() == 2);
00287   assert(dimension_tot_0_ * line_size() == size_array());
00288   const int n = dimension_tot_0_ * 2;
00289   dimensions_[0] = ++dimension_tot_0_;
00290   DoubleVect::resize_vect_(n+2, COPY_NOINIT);
00291   double * ptr = addr() + n;
00292   ptr[0] = a;
00293   ptr[1] = b;
00294 }
00295 
00296 //! Like append_line(i,j), but for arrays with line_size()==3
00297 inline void DoubleTab::append_line(double a, double b, double c)
00298 {
00299   assert(line_size() == 3);
00300   assert(dimension_tot_0_  * line_size() == size_array());
00301   const int n = dimension_tot_0_ * 3;
00302   dimensions_[0] = ++dimension_tot_0_;
00303   DoubleVect::resize_vect_(n+3, COPY_NOINIT);
00304   double * ptr = addr() + n;
00305   ptr[0] = a;
00306   ptr[1] = b;
00307   ptr[2] = c;
00308 }
00309 
00310 //! Like append_line(i,j), but for arrays with line_size()==4
00311 inline void DoubleTab::append_line(double a, double b, double c, double d)
00312 {
00313   assert(line_size() == 4);
00314   assert(dimension_tot_0_  * line_size() == size_array());
00315   const int n = dimension_tot_0_ * 4;
00316   dimensions_[0] = ++dimension_tot_0_;
00317   DoubleVect::resize_vect_(n+4, COPY_NOINIT);
00318   double * ptr = addr() + n;
00319   ptr[0] = a;
00320   ptr[1] = b;
00321   ptr[2] = c;
00322   ptr[3] = d;
00323 }
